desc: The HIST2H3D gene encodes H3.2, an H3 histone variant.

The HIST2H3D gene encodes histone H3.2, a replication dependent histone H3 variant (PMID: 21481529,26527279, 25539924). Histone proteins are an essential component of the nucleosome which consists of DNA wrapped around eight histone protein cores (two sets of each H2A, H2B, H3 and H4 histones), and therefore allow for the effective packaging of DNA in the nucleus (PMID:11498575). Histone variants, such as H3.1 and H3.2 have sequences that differ from the canonical histone protein by only a few amino acids and appear to be interchangeable with the major protein form (PMID: 25561719).
